headline: CS @UofT | Founder Lifomation | Engineer @Aquanow | Business Development Manager @Maple Bit Services | VP @UofT Entrepreneurship Association | VP @UofT CryptoClub
summary:
Hi there! My name is Adam Badar and I am a software engineering student at the University of Toronto. With a strong proficiency in C, Python, Java, Javascript, HTML, and experience with REACT, NODEjs, SQL, I am passionate about leveraging technology to create impactful solutions.

As an aspiring entrepreneur, I have been working at MapleBit Services for the past two years. As the developer of our website, I am well-versed in web design and development. Our company specializes in Agile consulting services and payment processing solutions through Fisrev. I am excited to connect with other business owners and learn from their experiences.

In my free time, I enjoy reading, working out, and playing sports. I am always looking for ways to expand my knowledge and skills, and I am eager to explore new opportunities in the tech industry.

Please feel free to reach out to me if you are interested in learning more about my experience or would like to connect!

experiences.title: Business Development Manager | Software Engineer
experiences.description:
- Successfully automated the extraction and processing of payment data from hundreds of PDF statements, reducing manual effort by 95%.
- Improved report accuracy and consistency, leading to enhanced decision-making capabilities for financial analysis and planning.

experiences.title: Licensed Tutor
experiences.description:
- Provided personalized, one-on-one tutoring in high school math, physics, and computer science to improve students' understanding and academic performance
- Developed customized lesson plans and teaching strategies that catered to the individual learning styles and needs of each student

experiences.title: Learning Experience Manager
experiences.description:
- Onboarded customers through constant follow ups to ensure seminars ran smoothly
- Created innovative and engaging courses for mentors through extensive research 
- Responsible for introducing the mentor and moderating each seminar by answering and resolving any issues faced by attendees

experiences.title: Call Center Representative
experiences.description:
- Enhanced communication skills by surveying over 200 individuals on a daily basis for the 2020 US elections
- Demonstrated flexibility and strong work ethic by taking up late-night shifts while balancing full-time studies

experiences.title: Food Server
experiences.description:
- Proficiently prepared and served food items to customers while providing exceptional customer service.
- Utilized bilingual fluency in French and English to effectively communicate with customers and assess their needs.

education.field_of_study: Computer Science, Specialisation in Software Engineering

education.school: St. John Paul II Catholic Secondary School

accomplishment_courses.name: Design and Analysis of Data Structures

volunteer_work.title: Vice President
volunteer_work.description: Organized and hosted events at the UofT Crypto Club, featuring industry leaders like the CEO of Bitfarms, the Canada's largest Bitcoin miner, and Sue Ennis, VP of Hut 8 and founders of Bitcoin Bay.

volunteer_work.title: External Director
volunteer_work.company: Indian Students' Association (ISA) at the University of Toronto Scarborough
volunteer_work.description:
- Increased sponsorships by 400% year-on-year, resulting in revenue growth from $500 to $2,000
- Personally secured $1,500 in sponsorship revenue through identifying, contacting, and negotiating with potential vendors
